Tell Me More!

Introduction

CDC-NIOSH | Young Leader-SME | Prairie State | University of Utah | Coal India | Tata Steel | ISM Dhanbad

Highly motivated and result-oriented professional with strong work ethics and unmatched experience of working in academia, federal government, and private industry. I have a multi-disciplinary background spanning the fields of occupational health & safety, risk management, and mining engineering. I aim to become an industry expert and continue to work and inspire people towards energy sustainability through both renewable and non-renewable sources of energy. Colleagues consider me a sincere and good team worker who is planned and focused towards achieving organizational and personal goals, and believes in work-life balance


Work Experience and Education

  • July 2015 - Present

    Center for Disease Control and Prevention

    Mining Engineer, Pittsburgh Mining Research Division
    Primary Research Areas: Longwall Mining, Ventilation, Methane Control, Shale Gas Wells, Micro-seismicity, and Ground Control.

  • May 2014 - July 2015

    Prairie State Generating Company

    Ventilation Engineer
    Designed and managed the ventilation airway network spanning over 150 miles, essential for the health and safety of over 200 miners working in the mine

  • Aug 2012 - May 2014

    University of Utah

    Master of Science (MS) in Mining and Mineral Engineering.
    Please find the Master's Thesis on Monitoring Systems for Coal Mines Utilizing Booster Fans here
    Research and Teaching Assistant, Public relations officer for Indian Student Association of Utah; International Student Ambassador; Member of Utah Tennis Club

  • June 2008 - July 2012

    Indian Institute of Technology Dhanbad

    Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech.) in Mining Engineering
    Member of University Soccer Team; Editor and Graphic Designer for University Newsletter

  • May 2011 - July 2011

    Tata Steel

    Summer Research Intern
    Solved the spontaneous combustion problem prevailing since 1976.
